hints.content: Start by understanding the rules of the tournament. Each round, teams are either paired up or one team advances automatically if the number of teams is odd.
Consider how to calculate the number of matches played in each round. If there are 'n' teams, when 'n' is even, the number of matches is n / 2.
For an odd number of teams, one team advances automatically, and the remaining teams are paired. How many matches would that be? Think about the formula: (n - 1) / 2.
You will need to keep track of the total number of matches played over all rounds. Initialize a counter to accumulate the matches.
Think about how to update the number of teams after each round. If 'n' is even, it becomes n / 2. If 'n' is odd, it becomes (n - 1) / 2 + 1.
Consider using a loop to simulate each round of the tournament until only one team remains. This will help you accumulate the total matches.
Make sure to handle the base case where n equals 1. In this case, no matches are played, and the function should return 0.
As you implement the loop, remember to check the parity of 'n' in each iteration to decide how to calculate matches and update the team count.
Pay attention to the constraints given in the problem. You should ensure that your solution works for all values of n from 1 to 200.
Finally, your function should return the total number of matches played once the loop concludes. Make sure to test your function with both even and odd values of n.

questionNotes: Return the total number of matches played until a winner is decided.
Handle edge cases, especially when n equals 1.
